Javascript Object Notation.  Text version of some JS data
We wait for every single line of code to execute one by one in order
Code that takes a long time to run doesn't take up focus - we can 'skip it' and come back to the result later
How to make our code async
Wrap the request with a promise
Use async/await syntax to handle the request
Surprise!  Behind the scenes these are all the same thing!
Provide a function to run after the request is completed
Browser says "ok, I'll wait for a response for you, feel free to do something else"
Pass 'false' to 3rd argument of 'open', add 'onload' callback
Used in many places with Javascript - not just for making requests
Used for handling async code.  Anytime we have an operation that takes a long time (making a request, opening a file, etc), we will likely handle it with a promise
Promises have three states - unresolved/pending, resolved, rejected
Response is successful!  We get our data
Request failed!  Wrong URL, or bad internet connection, etc

Request failed!  Wrong URL, or bad internet connection, etc
Any function provided to the '.then' function gets called with the response
Any function provided to the '.catch' function gets called with the error
Everything looks good, I'm about to send you some info

If a function uses a promise, we can make the code look synch instead of async
Functionality is not changing!  Everything is the same!
This is the recommended way to handle async code
